I already rode it in 2021, before my big injury/rebirth ü§ûü§ò Now I will be back and I am happy beyond words. items.content_html: Last night I had a dream where I was searching for a song. I heard the melody in my head and tried to find out which song it was. I didn‚Äôt find out in my dream. And now, I still hear the melody and MUST FIND THE SONG. This is how your dreams can become reality. ü´£

items.title: R√ºckblickend
items.content_html:
Ich schrieb ja, dass ich Bahn fuhr. Ich war unterwegs nach Werder (Havel) zu einem kleinen Hotel. Dort verbringe ich das Wochenende, allein und zur√ºckgezogen.

2018 und 2019 nahm ich mir die Zeit auf das Jahr zur√ºck zu blicken. Ich hatte ein gro√ües Notizbuch (A4! go big or go home!) zur Hand und schrieb mit Stift meine Gedanken dazu auf, wie das Jahr lief. Was war gut, was nicht. Und was war dazwischen. Anschlie√üend schrob ich den Ausblick auf das kommende Jahr; Machte mir Gedanken, was wichtig w√ºrde und was ich wertsch√§tzen m√∂chte. 2020 und 2021 machte ich das nicht. Am Ende von 2021 schrammte ich knapp an einem Burnout vorbei, wenn ich meiner √Ñrztin vertrauen m√∂chte. Es f√ºhlte sich zumindest auch sehr danach an.

Dieses Wochende werde ich jedenfalls wieder schreiben. Und nachdenken. Vor allem nachdenken.

Ich bin mit zwei Kunden, die ich ins neue Jahr begleiten darf, gut aufgestellt. Cashflow ist gesichert und die Perspektive gut. Mit Freunden evaluiere ich Ideen, was noch m√∂g√∂ich w√§re, wie die n√§chsten 5-10 Jahre noch abwechslungsreich und spannend werden k√∂nnten. Da habe ich ein bis zwei Ideen. Aber erstmal werde ich nachdenken. Und dann schreiben und dabei weiter denken.
items.content_text:
Ich [schrieb ja, dass ich Bahn fuhr](https://microblog.holgerfrohloff.de/2022/12/09/wenn-ich-mal.html). Ich war unterwegs nach Werder (Havel) zu einem kleinen Hotel. Dort verbringe ich das Wochenende, allein und zur√ºckgezogen. 

2018 und 2019 nahm ich mir die Zeit auf das Jahr zur√ºck zu blicken. Ich hatte ein gro√ües Notizbuch (A4! go big or go home!) zur Hand und schrieb mit Stift meine Gedanken dazu auf, wie das Jahr lief. Was war gut, was nicht. Und was war dazwischen. Anschlie√üend schrob ich den Ausblick auf das kommende Jahr; Machte mir Gedanken, was wichtig w√ºrde und was ich wertsch√§tzen m√∂chte. 
2020 und 2021 machte ich das nicht. 
Am Ende von 2021 schrammte ich knapp an einem Burnout vorbei, wenn ich meiner √Ñrztin vertrauen m√∂chte. Es f√ºhlte sich zumindest auch sehr danach an. 

Dieses Wochende werde ich jedenfalls wieder schreiben. Und nachdenken. Vor allem nachdenken. 

Ich bin mit zwei Kunden, die ich ins neue Jahr begleiten darf, gut aufgestellt. Cashflow ist gesichert und die Perspektive gut. Mit Freunden evaluiere ich Ideen, was noch m√∂g√∂ich w√§re, wie die n√§chsten 5-10 Jahre noch abwechslungsreich und spannend werden k√∂nnten. Da habe ich ein bis zwei Ideen. Aber erstmal werde ich nachdenken. Und dann schreiben und dabei weiter denken.

items.title: Wenn ich mal Bahn fahre‚Ä¶
items.content_html: Bin mit der Bahn unterwegs statt dem Auto. Will gar nicht weit fahren, nur ein bissel Regio. Aber der ist zu sp√§t und versp√§tet sich w√§hrend der Fahrt noch mehr. Schaffe meinen Anschluss nicht. Die Fahrt mit dem Auto w√§re warm und sch√∂n gewesen und h√§tte planm√§√üig schon nur 50% der Zeit gedauert. Jetzt fahre ich fast 3h und friere. So macht das keinen Spa√ü.

items.title: MacOs 12 makes it harder to know the selected keyboard layout
items.content_html:
MacOS 12.4 changes the display of the selected keyboard layout. Before 12.4 it used to be a country’s flag. I could discern the selected layout from glancing to the menu bar and recognize the flag (US or Germany). That was quick and easy. Now they changed it to show two white-ish letters or black background.

I have to read the actual letters to know the layout. I don’t think this really helps anything. It only makes things look more similar, uniform and boring. Maybe there is a setting to revert that back to colorful country flags, but I am not hopeful. üòë
items.content_text: MacOS 12.4 changes the display of the selected keyboard layout. Before 12.4 it used to be a country's flag. I could discern the selected layout from glancing to the menu bar and recognize the flag (US or Germany). That was quick and easy. Now they changed it to show two white-ish letters or black background. I have to read the actual letters to know the layout. I don't think this really helps anything. It only makes things look more similar, uniform and boring. Maybe there is a setting to revert that back to colorful country flags, but I am not hopeful. üòë

items.content_html: This morning I quickly set up an installation of FreshRSS to manage my RSS subscriptions. It syncs every 10 minutes on the server so my client (Reeder 5 on iOS) does not have to do the heavy lifting as it was always very slow. Its great now
items.content_text: This morning I quickly set up an installation of FreshRSS to manage my RSS subscriptions. It syncs every 10 minutes on the server so my client (Reeder 5 on iOS) does not have to do the heavy lifting as it was always very slow. Its great now

items.content_html: I’ve listened to the new Red Hot Chili Peppers album for a few times now. It feels good to her Frusciante’s voice and guitar playing. It was missed. There are a few songs that stick with me after the album ends. Sadly, it’s not great. But maybe that was too much to ask for.
items.content_text: I've listened to the new Red Hot Chili Peppers album for a few times now. It feels good to her Frusciante's voice and guitar playing. It was missed. There are a few songs that stick with me after the album ends. Sadly, it's not great. But maybe that was too much to ask for.

items.content_html: I brought an external display to my new desk in setting.io‚Äôs office. I really dig the change of scenery and having an optional commute again.

items.content_html: My micro.blog timeline is pretty empty during the day as I mostly follow people from US timezones.

items.content_html: I just spent more than 60 minutes reading up on Arel and trying a bunch of different things just to learn that it won’t work. So back to writing ugly SQL strings. Too bad.

items.content_html: Spatial audio with AirPods Pro when listening to music on my laptop is really confusing sometimes. After moving my head I wanted to make sure that the sound doesn’t come from the laptop’s speakers and indeed from the headphones. It appeared to come from the laptop. Crazy.
items.content_text: Spatial audio with AirPods Pro when listening to music on my laptop is really confusing sometimes. After moving my head I wanted to make sure that the sound doesn't come from the laptop's speakers and indeed from the headphones. It appeared to come from the laptop. Crazy.

items.content_html:
Well this is confusing. I am a web developer and still have trouble getting this sorted. I want to:

  • Publish and create microposts on my wordpress site
  • I want these posts to appear in my micro.blog timeline
  • I want to crosspost my entries to Twitter
  • I do not need a custom domain name for my Micro.blog updates
    I read the help section. I created a category on my wordpress and could post from the IOS app to wordpress. The posts do not appear in my Micro.blog timeline.
    What do I need to do differently @manton?
items.content_text:
Well this is confusing. I am a web developer and still have trouble getting this sorted.
I want to:  
- Publish and create microposts on my wordpress site  
- I want these posts to appear in my micro.blog timeline  
- I want to crosspost my entries to Twitter  
- I do not need a custom domain name for my Micro.blog updates  
I read the help section. I created a category on my wordpress and could post from the IOS app to wordpress. The posts do not appear in my Micro.blog timeline.  
What do I need to do differently [@manton](https://micro.blog/manton)?

items.content_html: I just read Paul Jarvis‚Äò latest email mailchi.mp/pjrvs/own… Now I am (again) motivated to turn away from platforms, switch to Linux and own everything I use. He‚Äôs very motivating in how he writes. So where to start?
items.content_text: I just read Paul Jarvis‚Äò latest email [mailchi.mp/pjrvs/own...](https://mailchi.mp/pjrvs/ownership-is-resistance?e=eacdb28695) Now I am (again) motivated to turn away from platforms, switch to Linux and own everything I use. He‚Äôs very motivating in how he writes. So where to start?

items.content_html: Using css modules the right way, I got it to work. üéâ In the end I had some naming clashes where I already tried to prefix my css class names with the module name‚Äîwhich is handled by css modules already. Because of this duplication it didn’t work. Now it does. Yay!
items.content_text: Using css modules the right way, I got it to work. üéâ In the end I had some naming clashes where I already tried to prefix my css class names with the module name‚Äîwhich is handled by css modules already. Because of this duplication it didn't work. Now it does. Yay!

items.content_html: I am working on my first React component library for my current client. Doing lots of things for the first time. Running into lots of roadblocks and things don’t really work like I expect them to. This might be simple, but it’s not easy.
items.content_text: I am working on my first React component library for my current client. Doing lots of things for the first time. Running into lots of roadblocks and things don't really work like I expect them to. This might be simple, but it's not easy.

items.content_html: This morning I took some detours on my way to my client by bike. I rode through some parks, chose small streets and enjoyed myself on my @8barbikes adventure bike. I‚Äòm very much in love.

items.content_html: From my friend Ian, I learned the value of putting a clear; in front of your test runs in the terminal. Wasn’t aware of the difference it makes for running your tests many times.
items.content_text: From my friend Ian, I learned the value of putting a `clear;` in front of your test runs in the terminal. Wasn't aware of the difference it makes for running your tests many times.

items.content_html: My submission to Euruko was rejected. ‚òπ That’s a pity, would have loved to visit Rotterdam. I still have 7 other proposals that might come through. Fingers crossed ü§û

items.content_html: Today I am working on a new visualization of fragmentation of ownership for Git repositories. The more fragmented a repo is, the more developers work on it together. This leads to no clear ownership and makes it easier for defects to creep into the code.
items.content_text: Today I am working on a new visualization of fragmentation of ownership for Git repositories. The more fragmented a repo is, the more developers work on it together. This leads to no clear ownership and makes it easier for defects to creep into the code.

items.content_html: I am reading the new edition of Refactoring by Martin Fowler these days. I am preparing a new workshop on Software Design and Architecture. I bet there are some ideas in there that will inspire me to create some specific exercises. #refactoring

items.content_html: I am now using Micro.blog for my microposts. I will crosspost my newsletters there. And whatever I think makes sense. I will figure it out by just trying. üòé
